required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Two Year Follow up of Cadence Total Ankle Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Two Year Follow up of Cadence Total Ankle Replacement

brief_summary.textblock: Over the last decades, total ankle replacement (TAR) emerged as a reliable treatment option in end-stage ankle osteoarthritis (OA) while preserving motion and physiological load. The Cadence™ is a fourth-generation, two-component, fixed-bearing implant with minimal tibial and talar resection. It has been in clinical use since July 2016, the purpose of this study was to compare the clinical outcome and radiological outcomes of total ankle arthroplasty with use of the Cadence™ prosthesis at St. Michael's Hospital.

detailed_description.textblock: Over the last decades, total ankle replacement (TAR) emerged as a reliable treatment option in end-stage ankle osteoarthritis (OA) while preserving motion and physiological load. The Cadence™ is a fourth-generation, two-component, fixed-bearing implant with minimal tibial and talar resection. It has been in clinical use since July 2016, the purpose of this study was to compare the clinical outcome and radiological outcomes of total ankle arthroplasty with use of the Cadence™ prosthesis at St. Michael's Hospital.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with end-stage ankle arthritis requiring surgical intervention.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Ankle arthritis treated with Cadence Total Ankle Replacement system
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 18 years of age
